reviews.text: Had this room booked for us. Thank god. What a great hotel. I'd already been at their hotel in Hamburg where I was very pleasantly surprised. This one is even better. I really liked the rooms, the super easy access to this hotel with public transportation, the location (Hanauer Landstrasse has lots of cool places to eat and drink), free wireless and comfortable rooms. The price was also optimal considering a convention started the same day (which means prices at the hotels in Frankfurt become absolutely ridiculous!) Breakfast in the hotel was very good as well although a bit small in my opinion. One negative aspect is that the bathroom in my room (Paris) was a bit cramped. Not a huge drawback but it just was tight and a bit more design oriented as oppossed to convenience.
reviews.title: What a great find in Frankfurt

reviews.text: I find this hotel very cool and confortable. Ihome available in all rooms.
reviews.title: cool rooms,good restaurant inside, less than 5 minutes walk from tube and tram

reviews.text: In front of it there is the best wurstel place in town. The access to tube and tram is easy (less than 5 minutes) I will definetely come again. GessD
reviews.title: A Real Treasure

likes.liked: — There were so many things. Value, cleanliness, staff, location, etc.
likes.disliked: — Really have nothing we didn't like. One must appreicate you won't have the same services (pool, etc.) as if you paid three times as much.

reviews.text: This hotel is a real find in a city of very expensive hotes. The rates are reasonable, the staff friendly and helpful, the rooms a good size for European hotels are clean, the beds excellent and the location fantastic if you don't care about being in the center of Frankfurt. The tram to the center is 1/2 block away from the hotel and takes about 10 minutes. Within 2 blocks is a remarkable supermarket and many little eateries and take out places. Be aware in Germany many things are closed on Sunday. In addition the hotel has a large room off the small lobby with tables, a TV and computer. We spent six nights in the hotel and needless to say were delighted.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because it is a small htoel there is not a conseirge to give you details of when things are open so bring your guidebook. Threre is always someone at the front desk to help. We had room 7 in the back which was very quiet and had great storage space. A special thanks to the staff for making our stay for confortable.
reviews.title: Uber Cool

reviews.text: The 25hours is a cool spot close to the center of the Frankfurt Downtown Core.
reviews.title: Funky & Fresh Design Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is great and the hotel feels warm and welcoming.
reviews.title: Surprisingly original 'feel' - first choice for next trip to Frankfurt!

reviews.text: Every room has a different design and every level is presented in a special color.
reviews.title: Not sure I will return

reviews.text: Check out the design story book at the front desk.
reviews.title: Cool Designer hotel

reviews.text: I got the Ernie & Bert room and just loved it!
reviews.title: Designer hotel with a great staff

reviews.text: This is a great design hotel with cosy rooms, good service, bar and restaurant. I stay here since it close to a vendor and its excellent for that reason. The rooms are very cosy - I had a ship cabin theme. The service is very friendly and they go out of there way to make you at home. The bar is great except for the barman which all I can say is he needs to work on his people skills. Every time I stay he always manages to annoy me and the people I meet. That;s the only negative which I laugh about now - its got very grumpy grand dad!
reviews.title: Another execellent stay dispite the Barman

reviews.text: Otherwise, this is a great place for a few days of work.
reviews.title: Funky hotel for the price

reviews.text: The look of this hotel from the outside is a bit deceiving. With each room being different, it was an interesting experience. At the front desk, I browsed through a book showing each room and picked one on the 7th floor. It was roomy enough and comfortable.
reviews.title: Cool Tight Squeeze

reviews.text: As some have said, it is not in the center of the city and you have to take a 10 - 15 min ride on the tram. However, the tram go along a route that is convenient if you want to see the old city and goes directly to the Banhof station.
reviews.title: Teresa on reception is amazing - the owner should give her a medal!

reviews.text: There are some amenities such as gym and pool that it does not have, but that is common for most euro hotels in my experience.
reviews.title: A bit of sorely needed whimsy in Frankfurt

reviews.text: 25hrs has always been a charm with great rooms and cool professnal staff. Always a comfortable stay with great rooms, especially the beds and decor. The staff is awesome and take care of you like a 5 star hotel. There are more hotels now in this hood but this one still rocks Frankfurt. Thank you 25hrs for staying exactly the way you are and breakfast is always a treat!
reviews.title: 5th time and still fantastic!

reviews.text: We visited Frankfurt for the Christmas markets and decided on this hotel based on the funny photos alone! Not a total mistake, the rooms were lovely and the decoration was entertaining. I would say that u have to be comfortable with whomever you are travelling with as there is no door to the shower room and the shower door is clear glass.
reviews.title: Great rooms, rubbish breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travel to the centre was very good, the tram/ bus stopped just outside the hotel and took us straight the attractions. The hotel staff were very helpful in telling us how to get around and it was easier than we thought.
reviews.title: Disappointing Choice

reviews.text: All in all it was a great stay although I would advise against having the breakfast. It was €84 for 3 days for 2 of us which to me is a bit steep for coissants and some fruit (!) head into town for a better deal.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel believes in individuality as each room is different. However the garish colours can be difficult to accept and the rooms are very small for two people. Staff are all very pleasant and helpful, breakfast buffet is pretty good. Not somewhere I would rush back to and I am sure you can better in the city.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near the Ostbahnhof (East Train Station)

reviews.text: Having happily stayed at the 25Hour Hotel Wien a few days before our trip to Frankfurt, I was quite confident enough to think that this same branded hotel would not disappoint. But it just wasn't the 25Hour brand that made me decide to book with them, but their affordability for a hotel in Frankfurt. Also important to note that our stay here was only for one night to catch our flight next day morning thus, the rigor for us to fully experience the hotel was slightly dampened because of the very short stay.
reviews.title: Affordability in Frankfurt

reviews.text: While the location wasn't as convenient to most tourist attractions, a tram right in front would take you right in the heart of Old Town Frankfurt in less than 10 mins; they also sold the tickets for these trams in the reception. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and very comfortable. There was also a presence of a well regarded, Michelin rated (confirm this with them if it is rated) restaurant right in the hotel that served everything from breakfast to dinner and seemed popular to the well heeled locals of Frankfurt. They also had a lounge next door for free Nespresso coffee, computer access while watching in their huge flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Helpful staff - excellent restaurant...

reviews.text: This is isn't your usual hotel though. No bellboys. No room service (though they do have suggestions for food deliveries). But for the price, this couldn't be beat. Don't think though that this hotel is extremely funky for the less brave traveller. Like the 25Hour Hotel Wien, their cool design was done in good taste.
reviews.title: Nothing for the colour blind, otherwise big fun

reviews.text: I spent one night at the Goldman 25hours Hotel as I was in Frankfurt for a meeting which was being held very close to the hotel and it was recommended to me by my business associates. My initial feeling was that the hotel is mainly geared for a much younger generation - it's funky and fun and the staff is all really young. That said everyone there is all out to help and very polite. The room is cute and I liked the separate shower/toilet. There was a fan in my room and hand on heart I'm not sure if it was air conditioned or not but it was kind of warm in the room though at least you can open the windows. There is free wi-fi available which is a great touch and the breakfast (which was not included in my room rate) is excellent. There is free expresso coffee available in the lounge and also a PC you can use for free. I had dinner at the hotel and the food was excellent too.
reviews.title: a brothel dressed up as a 'designer' hotel?

reviews.text: Very trendy design hotel in the business district. Every floor has a different colour ranging from relaxed to frenzy, so enquire when booking - Parisian theme is nice. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. Excellent kitchen, very nice breakfast. Not cheap but good value for the money. Truly worth a try!
reviews.title: Awesome design hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wanted to love this place-- the staff was warm and welcoming, however, they could not overcome the various inconveniences which made our stay intolerable: NO AIR CONDITIONING on floors 3 and above (!?@#$%), supposedly free "wireless" internet connection in each room did not work, and had to bring laptop down to the main floor parlor in order to use it, AND worst of all, the room was SO LOUD that even with earplugs we could not sleep at night. Of course, since there was no AC, it was necessary to keep the windows wide open, which made the noise level even more intolerable! It was so loud, that we had our TV on the loudest audio setting, and still couldn't hear it. (Our hearing is fine, by the way!)
reviews.title: Style over substance! Beware of inconveniences!

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the attempt at making the place unique and stylish
likes.disliked: — Lack of standard amenities such as air conditioning and working internet hookup in room.

reviews.text: Further, the configuration of the toilet being in a separate non-ventilated room than the shower/sink or bedroom, was not only stifling, but totally inappropriate for a room to be used by more than one person ; p
reviews.title: Stylish and well priced

likes.liked: — Modern,clean, heated floor in the bathroom

reviews.title: Nicely done but NO AIR CONDITIONING!
reviews.text: Yes the hotel was done out nicely but be warned...there is NO AIR CONDITIONING. The rooms are very hot (even in April) and opening the window is very noisy (on a main road) meaning sleep is nigh on impossible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I LOVE this hotel. This is the hotel I want to take all my friends too and share it with them. The hotel is so cool, without making you feel uncomfortable (like it's too cool for you). It's welcoming and fun. The staff were all very nice and helpful. The decor is so fun and interesting - each room is different. I loved staying here and wish they had more locations throughout Europe. The prices are great (we booked on the internet and paid 75 euro per night.
reviews.title: My new favorite European Hotel Chain!

reviews.text: Our room was on the 7th floor and the window in the shower wasn't an issue for us. I'm 5'6" and my husband is 6'4" and neither us were exposed in the shower. A woman over 5'9" may be slightly exposed (chest) to the outside, but I don't think it's a big deal. It's Germany, I think the neighbors have seen plenty of breasts and it's not as interesting to them as it is shocking to Americans that are used to more prudish views on nudity. If you're tall or on a lower floor and the shower exposes you then I'm sure the hotel will be happy to work with you to find a more suitable room.
reviews.title: perfect location for Frankfurt layovers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a great public room with games, books, and a computer for guests to use. The hotel offers you free bottles of water and newspapers. There were too many cool details to mention, stay there and discover it for yourself! The staff was very helpful and even printed our boarding passes for us. I love this hotel and hope they add more locations in the future!
reviews.title: trendy hotel for a decent price, but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed there twice and just love it. Very quiet rooms. Trendy cool very close to Haupbanhof..they loan you ipod if needed. chic touches throughout...Ocassional live music...nice roof top bar..
reviews.title: Brilliant - absolutely wonderful hotel, hidden gem!
